intro: Seseli patens, commonly known as the broadleaf seseli, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Seseli patens is also valued in traditional herbal medicine for its potential health benefits.
